column9: I am 43 years old and I began taking 80mg/day of Strattera for 7 years.  The primary difficulty of ADD I had trouble with was recalling facts when needed and concentrating while at work. Severe heart pounding sometimes non-rhythmic which caused pain in the chest.  This effect was never again seen with normal dosage.  Until I realized the food intake issue, I took the 40mg dosage twice a day, now I take both at the same time.  I receive yearly full physicals and have no damaged organs so far; everything is normal...slightly elevated cholesterol from the donuts. About 12 hours after the dose, there always elevated sexual arousal, it works better than the the other stuff. :)  There is a somewhat pronounced effect if a day is skipped. This is a sudden minor depression that takes hold about 48 hours after the last dose.  May just me however, unknown if it might be treating a depression I don't know I have. It's REALLY important to take it consistently, as I've learned. Despite the side effects, it does help me alot. Before, I was unable to just sit and DO my work, even if I really wanted to. It wasn't an issue of motivation, as it mostly can be, it was simply my brain not being able to do what I wanted it to.
